fields.description: This appears to be new since the 2.2-m1 upgrade on StAC:
fields.summary: Activity Stream RSS feed shows "null" bodies

fields.description:
FishEye 2.x now uses the HttpServletRequest URL info to generate some URLs.

Because HTTPS is terminated at Apache on Studio, FishEye does not know that it is using HTTPS unless the "proxy scheme" configuration is set to https. This has not been done consistently in the past, and perhaps in 1.x it didn't cause any problems, but it breaks a bunch of AJAX in 2.x so we need an upgrade task to ensure this is set correctly for SSL configurations.
fields.summary: Proxy scheme is not set to HTTPS in FishEye/Crucible

fields.description:
When a project is renamed in the Studio admin section, the new name is not propagated to Confluence, FE/Cru or Bamboo.

To replicate:
# create a new project (e.g. Test Project)
# verify project name is shown correctly in project drop down when creating a new review in crucible
# rename project via {{/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa}} to e.g. 'Test Project Renamed'
# project name in drop down when creating a new review in cru is still 'Test Project'. Wiki space name and bamboo project are also still the old name.
fields.summary: renamed projects are not updated in fecru

fields.description:
Management of the SVN password is quite confusing in Studio.  I've got Ed to create some docs on it (previously there were none whatsoever), however, I think some simple changes to the UI will make things a lot better.

# On the user profile screen, change the text of the "Change password" link to "Change SVN password"
# On the change password screen, add a "Forgot your SVN password link?" link.  This will send a password reset email to the currently logged in user (this means a user who forgot their SVN password is able to reset it themselves, because the change password screen requires the old password to be entered, which they might not know because this is not the same password as the password they use to log into JIRA).
# In the User Browser on the administration screen, changed the "Set Password" link text to "Set SVN Password".
fields.summary: Improved SVN password management in GApps mode

fields.summary: New Gapps users are not disabled by default with Crowd 2.0

fields.description:
Enhancement request

Please display string "Quick Search" or something in the search box.

It confuses users in Jira Studio when they see a drop down next to the unlabeled search box like "create issue +" or "browse".
fields.summary: Initialize Search box with 'Quick Search' text when empty

fields.description:
I suspect Crowd's crowd-ehcache.xml is being ignored in Confluence.

By default, we're shipping with a rather old version of the crowd-ehcache.xml file:

{code}
    <defaultCache
        maxElementsInMemory="50000"
        eternal="false"
        overflowToDisk="false"
        timeToIdleSeconds="1800"
        timeToLiveSeconds="1800"
        diskPersistent="false"
        diskExpiryThreadIntervalSeconds="120"/>

{code}

It only has one entry, and the Crowd caches that are being created are not using the values from this file.  They instead are using Confluence's ehcache.xml.  This can be verified by viewing Confluence's cache statistics and observing the MaxElements are 1000, not 50000 for Crowd caches.  I suspect this also means it's also not using the expiration settings either.

I suspect this is similar to this issue: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-1167

The suggestion in that case was to explicitly define all Crowd caches.
fields.summary: Update crowd-ehcache.xml to newer version

fields.description: to reflect the new changes - https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/INTSYS/Release+Notes+-+JIRA+Studio+Add-ons

fields.description: Some customers have accepted the limitation with English only support and are still using Studio.  They ask to install a language pack (at their own risk) and we usually do this, but as a side-effect, if they set JIRA as the default language to French for example, users now can't pick English from their user profile preference page.  Instead, it just shows two language options in the drop-down list, and both are French.
fields.summary: Can't change individual user profile's JIRA language preferences to English if Default JIRA Language is NOT English
Crucible permission scheme changes from repository manager does not translate from JIRA project to Crucible project correctly

fields.description:
The page is also known as 'Available Gadgets'.

As far as I can tell, there is no reason why this page should be restricted. It simply lists all the Bamboo gadgets available (including their URLs) and what they do.
fields.summary: The 'Gadgets' page in Bamboo should be exposed to those with Restricted Admin permissions

fields.description:
Sometime today the "Atlassian Support Account (Do Not Remove)" was added to a Crucible review in our JIRA Studio instance. The presence of this user seems to be causing review update emails to be sent to Contegix Support, since I was forwarded such an email from them with a polite request that they be removed.

I am the owner of the review and I cannot remove the Atlassian Support Account.
fields.summary: "Atlassian Support User" attached to Crucible review, cannot remove

fields.description:
This test tends to fail spuriously and needs some developer love or to be rewritten somehow so that it gives us reliable information.

https://hosted.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/SFT-PLUGINSJRE16/test/com.atlassian.studio.functest.TestBambooJiraAndFisheyeIntegration:setUp
fields.summary: TestBambooJiraAndFisheyeIntegration is unreliable

fields.description:
Responsiveness with IE7 appears significantly worst than IE8 or Firefox on complex and large dashboards with Activity Streams, Project Portlets, etc.

For example, studio.plugins.atlassian.com , when configured with the Activity Streams, and Projects portlet, load time is long, and it chews up quite a bit of CPU time.  Attaching comparison loading same page with IE7 and FireFox.  

Even *after* the page has completely loaded, clicking on links is slow.  IE7 hesitates after each click (CPU spikes) for about half a second to a second before the request is sent to the web server.

I'm not yet able to pinpoint this to any specific portlet, it appears to be a combination of factors.

Testing against jira.atlassian.com doesn't have similar penalties although the versions are not the same, nor is the content.  Will need further testing.
fields.summary: Dashboards slow on IE7; CPU Spikes

fields.description: The Studio blocked URLs return Centos' default 403 page when accessed outside the allowed list. Lets come up with a nicer one.
fields.summary: nicer 403 page for blocked URLs

fields.description:
We ran into a problem when we upgraded to Bamboo 2.5.1 in Studio 2.1.1: custom EC2 images needed to have their Bamboo agent version upgraded manually.

Uli added a feature to 2.6 that can be used by a script to automatically detect the Bamboo version and upgrade the agent: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-5683
fields.summary: Add the elastic agent upgrade script to the Studio EC2 images after upgrading to Bamboo 2.6

fields.summary: NPE adding project link to Fisheye via JIRA synchronization

fields.description:
On the JIRA project admin page, if there is a Crucible applink one will see something like:

Crucible Review: CR-ABC (crucible)  ( Select | Synchronize ) 

After clicking Synchronize, if the synchronization failed for some reason (eg. Fisheye return a HTTP 500 error), the URL directs to:

http://$host.jira.com/secure/project/ViewProject.jspa?message=editprojectlinks.error.synchronize&pid=10040

but the fact that there was a failure doesn't actually display anywhere in the UI.
fields.summary: Crucible project link synchronization fails silently

fields.description:
This creates problems for support when importing customer's local JIRA and Confluence into Studio.

The bug is: ProjectKeyTranslator keeps using an out-of-date association after it's retrieved for the first time.

The fix could be: add key association listener and whenever a key association event is received, clear the cache.

There is concurrency concern when making this change.
fields.summary: New project link between JIRA and Confluence does not work if the JIRA project key is not the same as the Confluence Space key, until restart

fields.description: The synchronisation should handle this gracefully and continue processing, and report the error when the task is completed.
fields.summary: Synchronise repo permissions to Fisheye fails if there is a permission scheme for a certain project is not found
Add an upgrade task to set the default review duration for new projects to 5 working days

fields.description: Currently CrucibleGlobalAdminServlet handles all requests from the global admin web interface in the studio-theme-jira plugin. It's monolithic and grows bigger by the day. It should be refactored, probably similar to the StudioServlet and have multiple resource handlers.
fields.summary: Refactor CrucibleGlobalAdminServlet

fields.description: Filing this request on behalf of a customer that would like to see this feature implemented.  Currently, users are not allowed to access to this feature.
fields.summary: Allow Bamboo to create plans from maven
Upgrade task to sync default repository permissions to the "agile" scheme
Update the "agile" scheme whenever default repository permissions is updated

fields.description: Project dropdown in wiki pages does not show column divider between recent projects and 'View all projects' and the 'View all projects' item is indented
fields.summary: Cosmetic issues in the project menu when viewing the wiki
History dropdown in wiki pages shows highlighted item as blank (the item icon is still visible)

fields.description:
When users click Administration > Bamboo > Plans, the default URL points to importMavenPlan.action

They will get the error: Access Denied

Along with the error, the *Plans* drop-down doesn't occur so they aren't aware of other functions inside unless they click on the adjacent arrow.
fields.summary: Bamboo Import Plan from Maven UI glitch

fields.description:
Users are reporting that if a form (eg. a JIRA comment) is filled in, left a while and then later submitted, they get a session timeout error.

In regular JIRA Studio, the login form has a 'Remember me' checkbox. This sets a persistent cookie (seraph.autologin) which automatically logs the user in should their native session have expired (which happens after 60 minutes' inactivity). When authentication happens via Google Apps, this cookie is not set and there does not seem to be a replacement.
fields.summary: Frequent timeouts in Google Apps-integrated Studios due to no "Remember me" cookie

fields.description:
I've made updates to this document warning users not to merge users based on email address as we've had several incidents now of this occurring:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Migrating+to+Google+Apps

Ultimately, we may have to do a sanity check perhaps in the user interface to ensure customers don't lock themselves out of their instances.

Filing this ticket so support can continue to track the frequency of this problem.
fields.summary: Improve google user sync to avoid customer lockouts
login gadget still disabled after rollback of Google Apps integration

fields.description:
For example,

https://studio.atlassian.com/JST should redirect to the homepage for the JST project (in our case https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST ).
fields.summary: Redirect project-key URLs to the JIRA project

SSO is broken when accessing the Bamboo tab with IE8 on Studio.

Users will see IE8 display the error: "Internet Explorer cannot display the webpage"

Related: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-1827

You can reproduce with test.jira.com

fields.description:
JIRA studio 2.1 includes Confluence 3.1 which enables users to embed gadgets into wiki pages.

That said, if someone wants to put an Atlassian gadget into their wiki page, based on data from within their own Studio instance, they have to manually add the gadget within the Confluence configuration screen.

These should be automatically available.
fields.summary: Atlassian Gadgets should be automatically in wiki pages

fields.description: Eg provide an instance of Archiva or Nexus in the Atlassian OnDemand package.
fields.summary: Provide a hosted Maven repository server for Atlassian OnDemand

fields.description: We need to use Streams-3.4 for FE/CRU 2 upgrade. Currently Streams-3.4-SNAPSHOT fails on Bamboo 2.2. So I'm trying to get it to build against Bamboo 2.5.1 that is used in Studio.
fields.summary: Upgrade Streams to work with Bamboo 2.5.1

fields.description:
This would allow quick Studio searches from the Firefox or Chrome address bar.

http://www.opensearch.org/Specifications/OpenSearch/1.1#OpenSearch_description_document

Confluence supports this in its native search box already. In Firefox, try typing 'cac opensearch' into the address bar and hit enter. It would be awesome to have that site-wide in Studio.
fields.summary: Studio search should support opensearch

https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/HS/FE-CRU+2.2+into+Studio+notes

fields.description:
Hi there,
we've been running into a few issues with Studio and fisheye/SVN. I've raised this issue on FE-2519, but this was closed and suggested I move it over here. I don't think it is a problem with the actual applications themselves, but specifically the Studio implementation. From what I understand from comments on the support jira, some of this is to do with design decisions within Studio.



*1. Performance of SVN*
I'm not sure how the SVN repository is hosted, but we are having a lot of problems connecting. I understand the Atlassian team in Sydney use this (we're also in Sydney) but we're getting very slow connections. Another repo we use (hosted in AU) we get connections of 800-1200k/s. With this one we get typically around 20-40k, and this can drop to 5k. It seems to refuse big connections, so if we freeze anything inside a project (eg: rails or a plugin) it will take at least an hour or so to make an initial commit.
I understand that having a hosted service won't suit every customer around the world geographically, but:
# this is completely different to the speed when accessing confluence and jira
# I'm ok with a bit of slowdown, but this is like using a dialup modem

I also understand this is a problem with the hosting provider rather than the software, but from what I have been told having the location of the repo locally is "by design" in Studio. I'm not sure if this is the case, but having this means issues like this can't get resolved.

2. Single repository
All of the projects in studio are in a single repository, which causes various weird things to occur, such as version numbers that jump around (the head version is for the last checkin of *any* project, rather than the project you are working on).
As a way of trying to speed up performance, I've asked the support team to turn off project level security. At that time I didn't understand that it was all just one repository rather than separate ones. Now I'm loathe to get it turned back on, just in case it makes it even slower.

3. Imports
Any imports or changes need to get handled by the support team. For a recent import of a not particularly big project (300mb), it took several days. Part of this was due to the very slow speed of the webdav area (seems to be around 5-10k/s). 

All of these issues could be resolved if I could just specify a URL for my SVN, rather than it being something I can't change. Perhaps this was left off in order to get Studio shipped, but it seems a shame - unfortunately it means for me that "source", "reviews" and "builds" are essentially broken features.

Since opening that initial ticket a week or so ago, my team are now refusing to use any of the fisheye/svn/review/bamboo functionality. So I've flagged this as a critical issue. I've been trying to get my team to use Studio for everything, but things reached breaking point this week where people were on a deadline and were unable to commit and capistrano deploys were failing to run.

I know you guys are pretty busy at the moment with Google marketplace, and didn't want this to seem a rant, but the SVN thing in Studio is causing me big headaches!
fields.summary: Problem with fisheye and SVN integration with Studio

fields.description:
We don't have too many customers using public signups but we do have studio.atlassian.com and studio.plugins.atlassian.com which are affected by this.

Users will just think their sign-up completed as the sign-up page refreshes and all values are cleared.

When creating new Studio project, set the default review time based on the new setting.
Add a new admin screen to allow customer to specify the default review time used by new Studio projects.
Add a new field in the review defaults admin screen for the default review time for existing projects
When creating new Studio project, copy the Crucible permission scheme based on the new setting.
Add a new admin screen to allow customer to choose which permission scheme to base on when creating new Studio projects.

fields.description:
When switching scheme, we should:
1. remove existing permissions (except those specified in point 3)
2. copy all permissions from the new base permission scheme (except those specified in point 3)
3. preserve the 'create' and 'view' permissions for groups (ie. do not preserve the 'create' and 'view' permissions for roles or specific users)
fields.summary: Change the review defaults admin screen to allow customers to choose on which permission scheme to base the permission scheme for an existing project
